reviewText:
Phenomenal game. Think super smash bros but much faster paced. A simple must buy with a great price. Hopefully this game will blow up.

Pros:

Very unique characters.

Developer active and helpful in discussion board.

Unique and balanced maps.

Map creator.


Arcade mode with challenging bosses.

Survival mode.

Skins for characters that can be bought with ingame currency. (no p2w)

No pay to win.

Player base big enough that playing online is easy.

------------------------------------

Cons:

No dedicated servers. (Meaning, the games you are in are hosted by other players, so sometimes it is laggy.

System for unlocking new characters is kinda silly. You can spend thousands of ingame money and not get any characters or get lucky and spend 25 and get new characters. But luckily a lot of the best characters are the ones you start with.

reviewText:
Fighties appears to be the first game developed by PillowPigGames. What a solid first development.

Let me start by saying the screenshots dont do it justice. The graphics, once in a game, are surprisingly smooth and polished.

Character design is excellent. Each character has wholly unique abilities and play style, which is an achievement rarely reached with such a large cast of characters. This is the major selling point for me. Each character you unlock will have genuinely unique skillsets/stats that will require a completely different strategy in game.

Many recent 2-D platform based competitive arena games dont add many new concepts, this is not the case with fighties. Combat is original and thoughtful, and they have not fallen into the trap of lazilly knocking off the abilities of other characters to complete their lineup.

The price, when compared to similar games, is incredibly generous considering the content. Honestly this game blows away other games with the same price. The price could be doubled, or possibly even trippled and still be reasonable.

reviewText:
Simple indie game with a decent amount of characters.
It's fun, and it now has online which I was dying to get.
This game is basically Castle Crashers art style + Melee except the combat is much more simple.

The mapmaking reminds me of scribblenauts if that means anything to anyone.

Edit#1: The first Arcade boss is still way too hard and unpredictable for an Easy" boss. Needler is still op in arcade mode and allows me to complete this boss with some gud random powerups but it still takes way too many tries. Hoping the change the order of the bosses or something later on. The game crashed once on me at the start but it hasn't happened again so that's gud. I also like how needler's bar thingies can be destroyed with melee attacks. He's still extremely gud though.

Edit #2: Now I have to refight the op boss to beat normal mode. Good thing I chose needler again.

Edit #3: That second boss though! It was freaking harder than I thought it would be as needler. I won't spoil anything but damn
date: it was hard. Felt gud when I beat it though.\n\nEdit #4: Multiplayer is dead at the moment b/c of lack of updates. I think the developers are working on one but multiplayer is still dead at the moment

reviewText:
Its a great fun fighting game to meele with friends.

So, maybe there is no real online gameplay (since no people seem to be online anymore) but local 4 player is great and IMO is better than Towerfall Ascension since there is great variability in the characters

And single player arcade is a challenge, you got easy, normal and hard, the difference? You face more enemies and more bosses (from 1 on easy to 3 on hard) as difficulty increases, also previous bosses HP increase, and let me tell you, both arcade modes (there is two version, each with their own 3 bosses) are HARD, depending on the character you are facing the boss it might be nearly impossible.

The hard boss on arcade 2 is a complete nut buster, The challenge is quite on par with most AAA figthing games and you will need to master all the movements mechanics and skills of your character to succeed.

There is one complain about this game, some characters are clearly stronger and easier to use and others frustratingly hard to use or have a not-so-useful skill. Specially on arcade or survival you will notice how some characters are too frustrating to use compared to others that do insta-kills or have better range.

Overall a great fighting experience with a lot of content

reviewText:
Fighties is a multiplayer fighting gam- hahaha no.

It's a fighting party game.

I'm not going to bother appeasing the Lethal League and Smash fans, I do not consider those games fighting games, and in no way does it make those games or this game worse, in fact, I enjoy all of them quite a bit.

Anyways...

It's a fighting party game with fast-paced action and a huge cast of characters that I haven't unlocked yet because I still haven't convinced myself to git gud at the game.

From what I know, there is not enough of a community for you to find any online games currently, I want that to change so I can speak of the multiplayer.

However, the gameplay itself is quite good, the characters are similar enough in gameplay for you to pick one up very fast without needing too much effort, but different enough to make them feel unique and also be hard to completely master, this simplicity comes from the fact that they all move in the same way and are the same size, meaning that no matter which character you pick, you will instantly know what to do after testing it's specials, and more often than not, it involves running and jumping in a bunch of directions and killing your opponent before he kills you.

However, some characters have some balance issues such as the noodle chopsticks kid which is the most known example, and the item system in this game is very un-indicative of what you're going to get, as all power-ups and items are indicated by animals in various colors that are impossible to memorize and are often over-powered as all hell, I am looking at you, shield giraffe...wait...which one is it again?

The sound design is kinda meh, music in this game is almost un-noticeable, it's too quiet in the main menu, and in the fight it's too low to hear, I turned up the music and nothing was really memorable, the sound effects are chip-tune-ish sounds and explosions, nothing new or interesting, it's bland.

The game is graphics are pixel art, now, I often find pixel art really grating, boring and I quietly â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing hate it, for once, I feel like it works well, because the effects are minimalistic and don't take up a lot of space on the screen, they also simplify things a lot, you will know who is who in game very quickly and it's actually kind of cute...I'm â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing with you, the gameplay and stages might be completely fine, but holy â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, the losing animations are just nightmare fuel, they go from cute like the character crying to mild with them being bandaged and having a few bones broken along with a bruised eye to THEM LYING IN A POOL OF BLOOD, DEAD, seriously, how do you go from point A to point Z like that?

So is the game perfect, no, is it good...?

Yes, definitely.

Sure, it has a some flaws however, the gameplay is just fun enough to keep me going, hell, I think I might place a few more hours into it, maybe a hundred or so.

I recommend, if you have the money to buy it (and by god, how would you not have it?) go ahead, dooo it, I need this multiplayer working or I'm going to punch something.

reviewText:

reviewText: This game has cute art, but other than that it is kind of broken. By this I mean fights are generally one sided based on what character you are facing/playing as. A few of the characters can instantly kill their opponents while the rest were given the short end of the stick, and can't score a kill for what seems like an undetermined amount of hits. You know there is a balancing problem when a handful of characters can kill from across the screen, while some melee character can't even kill in close range.\n\nAnother problem this game features is that once you've respawned you can immediatly be killed before you have the chance to react. This makes arcade mode even more difficult than it already is especially once you get to a two versus one, or a boss level. Bosses are nearly impossible unless you are playing as a character who instant kills even more so when the boss can kill you in one hit.

reviewText:
Fighties   Is it worth a buy, lets read, lets read, the words of the developer

A very solid game, it holds up very well to other fighting game franchises **SSBB**  **MKX** and the fact that it has 0 DLC makes me smile, seriously though is this the first game not to have DLC, and you look back to previous games that never got DLC, and now AAA companies are putting out DLC before the game is released... WATAFAK. Anyway this game is a fast paced 2-D fighting game that its main attraction is its price; at only $5.99 it has 30 characters which is more than MKX (at only 29) and many more than popular indie games such as Skullgirls (featuring only 12!)

Pros and Cons

Pros

Diverse characters - Having only unlocked about 20 of the 30 availiable charaters I allready can see that the roster is vary diverse in their playstyle and in thier looks.
Fluid controls - Coming from a console when I play a fighting game I expect controls that represent what I want to happen very well and imediatly, and this game does this very well.  Also im not sure if im just incompotent or just blind but i cant find an option to change the keybindings anywhere, could someone please point that out.
Awesome art style - Seriously, if you dont think this art is awesome you must be new to this planet because the pixel art is just so brilliant. Its bright and vivid colours make it almost pop culture and the character design is just brilliant.  My favourite is the red hair dude in the bottom left, hes a good lad and can fly, not even a good" character in my opinion but he looks cool and thats enough for me
Cons

Ridiculous boss fight - You fight your way up a ladder so to speak
date: pretty standard stuff until you reach a skull icon  "ohh a boss fight
recommended: sp00ky"  I told myself just before staying up still 3 just to beat the d**m thing. Seriously these bosses will make you cry\nDifficult to find help - I know this will come with time
hoursPlayed: but if your search up "Fighting char list"  21st july 2015 10:19 pm  its comes up with your bog standard MKX and street fighter character list
voteText: very difficult when your trying to find OP characters to beat the F***ing Bee boss as.\nLimited Community - No matter how hard you try
helpfulPercent: at no point I could find another player online
votesHelpful: I doubt the game is dead but
votesTotal: maybe a sale or something just to put up the numbers might just be in order. I can see this game being brilliant with a community.  Pillowpig take notes  Or you could make the game "free to play" and give out credits with money this would make the community much
votesFunny:
much bigger and you could still get money from it.

Conclusion

In conclusion for $5.99 your seriously getting a better deal than you should
commentsCount: even though the community is limited its still worth a buy. It does what many fighting games seek out to do but doesnt get flustered with "cheap money making tactics" that are dead obvious  MKX selling you "EZ fatalities"  instead it creates a solid fighting game that is well worked on and the effort put into it really shows
column16:
with a solid playerbase this game could seriously take off and become an extremely sucsessful business.

Grade

Overall I give this game 9/10

reviewText: This is not really a fighting game. Fighties is a casual, fun at parties maybe for an hour or something sort of game with a smash brothers sort of feel to it. reviewText:
Gotta say that, I really enjoyed this game. The gameplay is pretty fast-paced and fun, the characters all have their own unique play-styles that changes the game up a bit, the pixel art is really nice to look at, and there's a decent amount of content. There are a couple of flaws, though.

For one, the game's pretty unbalanced as some characters have attacks that can easily kill someone in one hit, while others have attacks that will take a couple of hits before it can kill someone. This can make the Arcade mode pretty annoying at times for some playable characters as you don't really have a lot of lifes on matches in Arcade mode and some attacks can kill you instantly.

Another issue is that the audio in the game isn't very good. The soundtrack could use a little bit more work as it consists of small and short tunes that wouldn't even work as ringtones, and the sound effects are pretty bland.

Despite those issues, though, I still really enjoyed this game. It's no Super Smash Brothers by any means, but it's still a neat, little game to play with friends. Plus, it's only 5$, so you won't be spending too much on this game.

- Try to balance out the abilities
-  Maybe make it so special abilities don't instantly kill a character but take a large amount of health off.

Overall this game has huge potential, you could even add a adventure part of the game (much like Castle Crashers). I can't wait to see what this game got for the future :)

reviewText:
It's an okay smash-like that is only good if you know some people to play it with. Sadly the music is grating and the online play is dead. Even if you manage to find people to play it with; there isn't enough to keep it interesting beyond a few matches.

If you're bored; the singleplayer is alright but it's not much to look at. Oh, and if level-editing is fun to you - look elsewhere.

Otherwise; cute graphics and characters!

reviewText:
This review is mostly about the local multiplayer aspect.

Fighties is a very fast-paced local multiplayer game which feels like a combination of the platforming and unique character abilities from something like smash bros and the quick one hit kills from a variety of other local mp games.

On paper the game is very much like smash bros. A diverse roster with unique moves, dashing, double jumps, stock mode is better than other modes and a goofy collectable minigame. However a few things make it feel very different.
1. Animations are super simple. One or two frames really.
2. Two moves per character and almost all of them are one hit kills.
3. Floaty. No character feels as if they have much weight at all.

All of this leads to a game that plays very very fast. Every character has their two moves which all have different levels of cooldown. I must commend the creators for making each and every character feel unique. However some of them are maybe 'too unique'. If there were a tier list for this game half of the roster would be piled up at the bottom. Still me and my friends have come up with very creative ways to use even the worst characters.

However most people I try to play with give up after a game or two. The insta-death is very discouraging in this game compared to other games with one hit kills. The reason most have given me is that they feel like they had no options for dealing with the death. They think that due to their character choice they stood no chance against whatever the others were playing.

The characters all look cute even if they are a tad generic. The stages all look fine but I think they would benefit from some animation, even some simple stuff like leaves or rain. I really detest the music, I get that his is suppossed to be cutesy game and all but the music is just flat out bad. It doesn't match the pace of the game at all and to be honest barely sounds like music.

In conclusion this game is not for everyone. I would give some videos a look and maybe give it a try if you can before buying as this game really rides on its first impression.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Personally, I love Smash Bros and when I found out there was a game like that on Steam, I was ready to pay any amount of money for it (as long as it's not insanelly high). Luckily, my friend bought it for me and believe me when I played it once, I kept playing it for 5 hours. If you have nothing better to do, load up Fighties and watch a couple of hours fly by. It has a few things that need to be fixed but to me it's worth it's price. Overall 8/10
